|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 4KEc |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 180 |is_doc = |bus = 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none --> |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = STMicro;25P16V6P; |flash1size = 2 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 8 |ram1chip = ISSI;IS42S16400B-7TL; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = IC+;IP101; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:1A:C1, 00:1E:C1 |oui = 00:1A:C1, 00:1E:C1 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = VxWorks;;; |exp_if_types = none |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, 9-pin header,, internal,, 3.3V TTL,, unpopulated,, Gemtek type1 pinout,, (9600 8N1),, JP1 |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bg |defaulip = 192.168.1.250 |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = 3Com |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = Gemtek |manuf_model = WAPA-139G |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 03/31/2006 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China, Taiwan |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL, RP-SMA |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "WAPA-139G"(...) and "190-C03-06"(...) is silkscreened on a production model board. :The Wi-Fi radio is using a '''Microchip''' ('''SST''') SST12LP14 power amplifier and an '''NEC''' UPG2035 / UPG2035T5F (??) DPDT switch. The power adapter included with the device appears to be a '''3Com''' branded 3C12VUS.. which is a '''DVE''' DSA-15P-12 US 120120 (100-240VAC ~ 50/60 Hz, 0.5A -> 12VDC, 1A). ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Info derived from==== {{SCollapse|boot log |

ar531xPlus rev 0x00000087 firmware startup...


Atheros AR5001AP default version 4.0.0.167

auto-booting...

Attaching to TFFS... done.

wl1_root_ap_mac=00:00:00:00:00:00

ae0 macaddr = 00:1a:c1:36:bf:02
ser=9TDR8QK36BF02
start easyconf 08022006
wireless access point starting...
channel 2462
wlan0 Ready
Ready

easyconf: a channel is

easyconf: g channel is 11

easyconf: a channel is 0

easyconf: g channel is 11

easyconf: G no security
easyconf: Fail to SetSockopt IP_MULTICAST_LOOP
easyconf: Fail to SetSockopt IP_MULTICAST_TTL
easyconf: enter while(1)dhcpcBind
}} ====get hardware====

wlan0 revisions: mac 11.0 phy 4.8 analog 7.0

  Sub Vendor ID: 0x168c, Sub Device ID: 0x13
chip is AR5315

AP software 4.1.4.19

Dec 29 2006, 11:56:16
